DataElement.preferredName: Axillary Lymph Node Surgical Procedure Performed Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of axillary lymph node surgery that was carried through to completion.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Axillary Lymph Node Surgical Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of approximately 20-30 lymph nodes in chain formation that traverse the concavity of the underarm to the clavicle._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of approximately 20-30 lymph nodes in chain formation that traverse the concavity of the underarm to the clavicle.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Concepts.definition: One of approximately 20-30 lymph nodes in chain formation that traverse the concavity of the underarm to the clavicle.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/15/22 jk UCSF ISPY-2 AI, released as part of quarterly content review and prior reviews with SMEs.  5-14-19 tt created for Breast surgical therapy module.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Axillary Lymph Node Surgical Procedure Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: One of approximately 20-30 lymph nodes in chain formation that traverse the concavity of the underarm to the clavicle._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.: An indication that an individual was offered surgical intervention but decline to undergo surgery.: Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
An indication that an individual was offered surgical intervention but decline to undergo surgery.
Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the lymph nodes located in the cavity beneath the junction of the arm and the thorax, or axilla (armpit).  This procedure is commonly performed as a component of cancer staging.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the lymph nodes located in the cavity beneath the junction of the arm and the thorax, or axilla (armpit).  This procedure is commonly performed as a component of cancer staging.
